description: a(1,2) = 1,2. let i,j represent a(n-2), a(n-1) respectively and let M(i) = {i,j}. For n > 2, if one of i,j is prime (p), and the other (m) is not, then if p!|m, a(n) is the least novel multiple of p. If p|m, a(n) = p*m. If both terms in M are nonprime a(n) is the least novel multiple of the smallest prime which does not divide i*j.
